      • authenticateUser

        public DominoClientBuilder authenticateUser(String serverName,
                                            String userName,
                                            String password)
        Accesses NSFs as a specific user, validating the password when the client is constructed.

        This is distinct from the password assigned to a Notes ID file, but instead refers to credentials according to an active local runtime or remote server.

        Parameters:
        serverName - remote Domino server to authenticate against. May be null to use the local runtime
        userName - Domino username to access as
        password - the user's password
        Returns:
        this builder
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if userName is null or empty

      • authenticateUserWithToken

        public DominoClientBuilder authenticateUserWithToken(String serverName,
                                                     Object token)
        Accesses NSFs as a specific user, validating the provided credentials token with any registered providers.

        This is distinct from the password assigned to a Notes ID file, but instead refers to credentials according to an active local runtime or remote server.

        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the server to contact
        token - the token to use to authenticate. The class of the token depends on the available provider implementations
        Returns:
        this builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if token is null
        Since:
        1.0.19

      • withFullAccess

        public DominoClientBuilder withFullAccess()
        Accesses the NSFs and server with full access
        Returns:
        DominoClientBuilder this builder
